PoseHistogram.H

00001 #include <math_basics.H>
00002 #include <vector>
00003 #include <list>
00004 #include <cmath>
00005 #include <iostream>
00006 
00007 namespace pose_clustering{
00008 
00009   typedef std::vector<my_float_t> pose_t;
00010   typedef std::vector<pose_t> pose_vec;
00011 
00012   class PoseHistogram{
00013   public:
00014     PoseHistogram(uint bins_in, uint min_poses_in)
00015     {
00016       nbins = bins_in;
00017       min_poses = min_poses_in;
00018     }
00019   
00020     ~PoseHistogram() 
00021     {
00022       std::list<pose_vec*>::iterator li;
00023       for(li = bins.begin(); li != bins.end(); ++li) delete *li;
00024       bins.clear();
00025     }
00026 
00027     // Expects [Tx Ty Tz theta0 theta1 s]
00028     void histogram(const pose_vec& poses_in)
00029     {
00030       pose_vec poses(poses_in.begin(), poses_in.end());
00031       get_space_bounds(poses);
00032 
00033       // Again need to check if theta1 and s are circular
00034       circular.resize(6);
00035       circular[0] = circular[1] = circular[2] = circular[5] = false;
00036       circular[4] = false;
00037       circular[3] = true;
00038 
00039       subdivide_current_bin(&poses, 0);
00040     }
00041 
00042     std::list<pose_vec*>::const_iterator begin() const
00043     { return bins.begin(); }
00044 
00045     std::list<pose_vec*>::const_iterator end() const
00046     { return bins.end(); }
00047      
00048     size_t size() const { return bins.size(); }
00049   
00050   private:
00051     void get_space_bounds(const pose_vec& poses)
00052     {
00053       bnds.resize(12);
00054       std::fill(bnds.begin(), bnds.end(), my_float_max);
00055       for(uint i = 0; i < 6; ++i) bnds[i+6] = -bnds[i];
00056       pose_vec::const_iterator pose;
00057       for(pose = poses.begin(); pose != poses.end(); ++pose){
00058         pose_t tmp = *pose;
00059         for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00060           if(tmp[i] < bnds[i]) bnds[i] = tmp[i];
00061           else if(tmp[i] > bnds[i+6]) bnds[i+6] = tmp[i];
00062         }
00063       }
00064 
00065       // theta0 is in [-pi,pi]
00066       bnds[3] = -M_PI - 0.0001;
00067       bnds[9] = M_PI + 0.0001;
00068       // theta2 is in [-pi/2, pi/2]
00069       bnds[4] = -M_PI_2 - 0.0001;
00070       bnds[10] = M_PI_2 + 0.0001;
00071       // s is in [0,1]
00072       bnds[5] = -0.0001;
00073       bnds[11] = 1.0001;
00074       
00075       // Kludge to enlarge the bounds enough so that the extreme points of the
00076       // bounded regions are not included in the poses.
00077       for(uint i = 0; i < 3; ++i){
00078         bnds[i] -= 0.0001;
00079         bnds[i+6] += 0.0001;
00080       }
00081 
00082       step_sizes.resize(6);
00083       for(uint i = 0; i < 6; ++i) step_sizes[i] = (bnds[i+6] - bnds[i]) / nbins;
00084     }
00085 
00086     // depends on implementation of push_back whether it is more efficient
00087     // to store intermediaries in vectors or lists
00088     void subdivide_current_bin(pose_vec *poses_in, const uint level)
00089     {
00090       // Init the bins for this level
00091       std::vector<pose_vec*> level_bins(nbins);
00092       for(uint i = 0; i < level_bins.size(); ++i) level_bins[i] = new pose_vec;
00093 
00094       //std::cout << "level is: " << level << std::endl;
00095       //std::cout << "lower bound is: " << bnds[level] << std::endl;
00096       //std::cout << "step size is: " << step_sizes[level] << std::endl;
00097       pose_vec::iterator pose;
00098       for(pose = poses_in->begin(); pose != poses_in->end(); ++pose){
00099         //for(uint i = 0; i < 6; ++i) std::cout << (*pose)[i] << " ";
00100         //std::cout << std::endl; 
00101         my_float_t val = ((*pose)[level] - bnds[level]) / step_sizes[level];
00102         //std::cout << "val is: " << val << std::endl;
00103         int bin = static_cast<int>(val);
00104         //std::cout << "bin: " << bin << "   nbins: " << nbins << std::endl;
00105         level_bins[bin]->push_back(*pose);
00106         
00107         // check for overlap
00108         my_float_t rem = val - bin;
00109         if(rem <= 0.2){
00110           if(bin) level_bins[bin - 1]->push_back(*pose);
00111           else if(circular[level]) level_bins[nbins - 1]->push_back(*pose);
00112         }else if(rem >= 0.8){
00113           if(bin + 1 < nbins) level_bins[bin + 1]->push_back(*pose);
00114           else if(circular[level]) level_bins[0]->push_back(*pose);
00115         }
00116       }
00117       poses_in->clear();
00118       if(level) delete poses_in;
00119 
00120       std::vector<pose_vec*>::iterator vi;
00121       for(vi = level_bins.begin(); vi < level_bins.end(); ++vi){
00122         //std::cout << "number of poses in bin: " << (*vi)->size() << std::endl;
00123         if((*vi)->size() < min_poses){
00124           (*vi)->clear();
00125           delete *vi;
00126           *vi = NULL;
00127         }else if(level < 5) subdivide_current_bin(*vi, level + 1);
00128         // Depends on how we wish to represent the bins -- for now we are trying
00129         // to get pose clustering working and to evaluate it -- we wish to 
00130         // have access to all the poses in each bin for stats/analysis
00131         else bins.push_back(*vi);
00132       }
00133     }
00134 
00135     std::vector<bool> circular;
00136     std::vector<my_float_t> step_sizes;
00137     std::vector<my_float_t> bnds;
00138     // Likely to be faster if use a vector of pose_vecs -- location should
00139     // trump cost of copying data.
00140     std::list<pose_vec*> bins;
00141     uint nbins;
00142     uint min_poses;
00143   };
00144 }
